content: What American author, known for his wit and satire, wrote the 1920s novel "The Great Gatsby"?

F. Scott Fitzgerald is the American author known for his wit and satire who wrote the 1920s novel "The Great Gatsby". This novel is celebrated for its exploration of the American Dream and the decadence of the Jazz Age, reflecting on themes of love, wealth, and social status through the eyes of its characters, particularly Jay Gatsby and Nick Carraway.
